intro: Camptosorus ebenoides, commonly known as the African mahogany or yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas, contributing to local biodiversity. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered a species of conservation concern.
